ALABAMA EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION COMMISSION
714 PROTECTIVE LIFE BUILDING
BIRMINGHAM, ALABAMA
RAYMOND D. HURLBERT. Birmingham
President
THOMAS D. RUSSELL. Alexander City
Secretary
- June 16, 1954
MILTON K. CUMMINGS. Huntsville
REX SIKES. Luverne
MRS. T. S. ACKER. Ohatchie
Mr. Graydon Ausmus, President
National Association Educational
Broadcasters
Box 2002, University of Alabama
University, Alabama
bear Graydon:
The Alabama Educational Television Commission is applying for
Channel 2 to be located at Andalusia. This will complete the planned educa¬
tional television network for the State with a 95% coverage. At the present
time commercial interests of Tallahassee, Florida are also applying for the
same channel. The Alabama Educational Television Commission feels that if
the Federal Communications Commission fully appreciates Alabama’s felt need
and the public demand for such complete coverage, including the southern one-
third of the State which Channel 2 would serve, favorable action in our be¬
half might be expected. A letter from you, from your position as President of
NAEB, expressing your request for such favorable action in Alabama's behalf
will certainly help create the desired results. The following data might be
used in your letter but should be stated in your own words as others in the
State are being asked to make similar appeals.
1. The 3 VHF channels as planned will give almost complete State
coverage.
2. If Channel 2 is not included the southern one-third of Alabama
will lack coverage.
3. This will help serve as a pilot or example in the national pic¬
ture of educational television. This is a very real opportunity to give educa¬
tional television its chance to succeed.
4. In the case of extreme eventualities this particular channel
can well serve as a direct outlet for Alabama Polytechnic Institute, as could
Channel 7 for University of Alabama and as could Channel 10 for the Birmingham
Area Educational Television Association, Inc.
5. The State of Alabama has already provided sufficient public
funds to set up this statewide program and can proceed with construction if
given proper authority.
Please write the requested letter at your earliest convenience as
the decision in the matter is expected in the near future.
